articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Conveys Sympathy to Namibian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Conveys Sympathy to Namibian President

					
						 
					 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Monday sent a message of sympathy to Hifikepunye Pohamba, president of Namibia, as regards the recent flood that hit the northern area of the country, causing damage.

					Expressing deep sympathy and consolation to the people in the stricken-area, Kim in the message hoped that the government and people of Namibia would eradicate the aftermath of the natural disasters as soon as possible under the correct leadership of the Namibian President.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Inspects Work of Various Domains in Northern Area
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Inspects Work of Various Domains in Northern Area

					
						 
					 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- Choe Yong Rim, premier of the DPRK, visited the Musan Mining Complex, the Soksong Coal Mine under the Myongchon Area Coal Mining Complex and the Ryongjon Fruit Farm in northern area of the country from March 30 to April 1.
					The premier took economic measures to speed up the work for putting the mining and carrying equipment on a larger and modern basis at the Musan Mining Complex, a nation's leading concentrated iron ore producer, and thus remarkably increase the production in the shortest period through massive ore cutting and dressing.
					
					He discussed the matter for stepping up the pit construction and securing more cutting faces at the Soksong Coal Mine in keeping with the progress of the Hungnam gasification project going on at the final stage.
					
					He also went round the Ryongjon Fruit Farm, which was turned into a modern one on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the Pukchong Enlarged Meeting. He organized the work to solve the issues arising in putting the fruit production on a scientific, intensive and modern basis and radically expanding the area of orchard.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Congratulates FM of Myanmar
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Congratulates FM of Myanmar

					
						 
					 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a congratulatory message to Wunna Maung Lwin upon his appointment as foreign minister of Myanmar on April 1.
					Expressing belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries will as ever grow stronger in various fields including politics, economy and culture in conformity with the common desire and interests of the two peoples, the message wished for success in his work.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Congratulates Mauritanian FM
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Congratulates Mauritanian FM

					
						 
					 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Monday sent a congratulatory message to Hamady Ould Hamady upon his appointment as minister of Foreign Affairs and Cooperation of Mauritania.
					The message expressed belief that the long-standing friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries will grow stronger in the future and wished for success in his work.

articles.title: Revolutionary Site on Munsu Hill
articles.content:
Revolutionary Site on Munsu Hill

					
						 
					 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- As part of the spring tree-planting campaign in the DPRK, many trees have been planted at the Revolutionary Site on Munsu Hill in Pyongyang.
					On April 6, Juche 36 (1947), President Kim Il Sung, together with anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk and Kim Jong Il, climbed the hill and planted trees to kick off a nationwide forestation movement.
					
					After planting trees together with Pyongyang citizens, the President commanded a bird's-eye view of Pyongyang and called for turning the capital into a beautiful city and converting the hill into a public recreation ground.
					
					That day Kim Jong Suk met with some women and underscored the need to plant many trees in mountains, true to the intention of the President.
					
					Larch trees planted on the hill by the three commanders of Mt. Paektu are still growing well.
					
					There is a monument to their tree planting on the hill.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blames S. Korean Authorities for Bedeviled N-S Relations
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blames S. Korean Authorities for Bedeviled N-S Relations
						

					
						 
					Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities are chiefly to blame for the escalation of tension on the Korean Peninsula and bedeviled north-south relations, DPRK major newspaper Rodong Sinmun says in a bylined article on Tuesday.
					Owing to the south Korean ruling forces' reckless moves to pass the buck for the warship sinking case to the DPRK at any cost, the atmosphere of improving the relations created with much effort between the north and south was totally frozen and the situation on the peninsula is again edging towards the grave phase of confrontation, the article says, adding:
					
					The present collapse of the north-south relations was not caused by the warship "Cheonan" case. It is an inevitable consequence of the south Korean ruling forces' anti-DPRK confrontation policy and part of it.
					
					The failure of south Korea's "policy towards the north" was clearly proved in the past three years. Nevertheless, its authorities insist on this confrontation policy, persistently refusing to make a switchover in it.
					
					This is well evidenced by the fact that they still raise it as a precondition for warming up the north-south relations to take "responsible measure" over the "Cheonan" case, even though one year has passed since the case, and are staging madcap anti-DPRK confrontation and war maneuvers under this pretext.
					
					If the south Korean authorities have a bit of willingness to patch up the north-south relations, they should no longer link the case with the DPRK.
					
					Their persistence in the case will only show their black-hearted intention to push the north-south relations to total bankruptcy by labeling their fellow countrymen as a "provocateur" and inflict a disaster of nuclear war upon them.
					
					They should opt for improvement of the north-south relations as soon as possible, squarely seeing the aspiration of all Koreans desirous of improved north-south relations, stability and peaceful reunification of the Korean Peninsula and co-prosperity of the nation as well as the trend of the times. The improvement of the north-south relations and peace of the peninsula entirely depend on the south Korean authorities' attitude.

articles.title: US Censured for Intensified War Moves against DPRK
articles.content:
US Censured for Intensified War Moves against DPRK
						

					
						 
					 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- Minju Joson Tuesday in a signed commentary condemns the U.S. and the south Korean puppet group for getting hell-bent on the war moves for aggression on the DPRK while escalating the military confrontation and tension.
					The U.S., together with the south Korean puppet forces, staged a big sea munitions supply drill as part of the Foal Eagle joint military maneuvers on March 23. This makes one clearly see the aggressive nature and danger of the war exercises, the commentary notes, and says:
					
					In a word, the main aim sought by the U.S. warmongers through the maneuvers is to neutralize and stifle the DPRK by mounting preemptive attacks in three dimensions on the strategic depth and major vantage points of the DPRK with the mobilization of nukes and all other means.
					
					What is more serious is that the U.S. is zealously working out a plan on extremely adventurous attack while advertising about "threat" by somebody.
					
					On March 28 the U.S. warmongers had a meeting of the extended deterrence policy committee together with the south Korean puppet forces.
					
					This was timed to coincide with the dangerous Foal Eagle. It was a dangerous war conspiracy intended to further strengthen the cooperation system for aggression on the DPRK with the aggravated situation of the Korean Peninsula as a chance and thus bring about disaster of nuclear war at any cost.
					
					That is why the U.S. has massively hurled huge armed forces and latest military equipment into the ongoing Foal Eagle maneuvers and frantically conducted various forms of military exercises to cope with any possible circumstances at wartime.
					
					Due to the U.S. imperialists' war moves, clouds of nuclear war are now hanging over the Korean Peninsula and peace of the peninsula and Northeast Asia is exposed to a grave threat. This gives a negative influence on global peace.
					
					If the U.S. imperialists dare ignite a new war, the army and people of the DPRK will deal a merciless punishment at the aggressors by mobilizing all military means.

articles.title: S. Korean Military Authorities Urged to Scrap War Plan
articles.content:
S. Korean Military Authorities Urged to Scrap War Plan

					
						 
					 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea in a commentary on Friday urged the military authorities to scrap the "plan 307 for defense reform".
					It said that the plan recently announced by the Ministry of Defense is evoking bitter criticism for its danger and gravity.
					
					The plan is dangerous as it contains the possibility of recalling the past era of military dictatorship by investing the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff with all authorities including the right to command operations, it noted.
					
					In particular the plan makes the authority of the commander of the Marine Corps reach even the three services, the commentary said, adding: This shows the intention to keep the West Sea of Korea as waters of dispute.
					
					The plan is for a war as it allots the role of the south Korean army according to the commanding system of the U.S. forces with main stress put on the alliance with the U.S., it charged.
					
					The commentary held that the reckless plan should be repealed at once as it is aimed to ignite a war on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Authorities' Sycophancy toward US Accused in S. Korea
articles.content:
Authorities' Sycophancy toward US Accused in S. Korea
						

					
						 
					 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Progress in south Korea issued a statement on March 31 to denounce the authorities for taking the lead in speaking for the interests of the U.S.
					
					 It was disclosed that the authorities are planning to make south Korea bear even the cost for transfer of the U.S. Second Division base, the statement said, adding:
					
					 The authorities deprived the inhabitants of land to offer the U.S. for realizing the strategic flexibility of the GIs pursuant to the U.S. military strategy. Not content with it, they seek to provide the fund for the transfer of military base.
					
					 The statement deplored that south Korea is in a position to bear even the cost for decontaminating the polluted land returned from the U.S. forces.
					
					 It demanded that the authorities abolish the alliance with the U.S., a main obstacle that threatens the people's vital rights and wrecks peace on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Joint Action against Dictatorship Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Joint Action against Dictatorship Urged in S. Korea

					
						 
					 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- Personages of different circles in south Korea, who suffered from the fascist "National Security Law," held meetings on March 24 and 31 to call for an organization to take a joint action against the outrages of the dictatorial regime.
					At the meetings speakers noted that many people have been subjected to the NSL for the mere reason that they struggled to put an end to the history of division and reunify the country.
					
					The present authorities are getting hell-bent on crackdown on the inhabitants by dint of the NSL despite the evermore growing voices of the people at home and abroad who demand the abrogation of the fascist law, revealing its nature against human rights and national reunification, they charged.
					
					They declared that they would form an organization with the victims to the evil law to fight against the suppression by the power.

articles.title: Japan's "Claim" to Tok Islets Censured
articles.content:
Japan's "Claim" to Tok Islets Censured

					
						 
					 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- Professors of south Korea and Japan held a seminar in Seoul on March 31 to disclose the absurdity of Japan's "claim" to Tok Islets.
					Speakers at the seminar called to task the fact that the Japanese authorities had Japan's "dominium" over Tok Islets, lack of academic ground, written on new middle school textbooks for 2011 while claiming that the islets are "illegally occupied" by south Korea.
					
					They stressed that there is no possibility for the islets to belong to Japan in view of history or law.
					
					Pointing to the unreasonableness of the Japanese authorities' "claim" to Tok Islets, they declared that they would continue the action of proving that the islets are an inviolable territory of the Korean nation.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Off Press in Venezuela
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Off Press in Venezuela

					
						 
					 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's work "For the Complete Victory of Socialism" was brought out in booklet by the Canta Clara Publishing House of Venezuela on March 25.
					The work, published on December 30, Juche 75 (1986), deals with the historical inevitability of the complete victory of socialism and the basic matter arising in achieving this victory and its ground.
					
					It clarifies the need to push ahead with socialist economic construction and strengthen the people's power and enhance its function and role, the urgency of national reunification and way for achieving it.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Commemorated in South Africa
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Commemorated in South Africa

					
						 
					 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- A South African preparatory committee was formed on March 25 to commemorate the Day of the Sun, the birthday of President Kim Il Sung.
					Present at its inaugural ceremony were personages and members of the South African Communist Party and the African National Congress of South Africa.
					
					The preparatory committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.

articles.title: Significant Days of DPRK Commemorated Abroad
articles.content:
Significant Days of DPRK Commemorated Abroad

					
						 
					 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- Seminars were held in Switzerland and South Africa on March 26 to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung and the 79th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
					Present there were personages of the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Group for the Study of the Progressive Ideas and the Democratic Teachers Union of South Africa and popular masses.
					
					At the seminar on Kim Il Sung's work "On the Occasion of Founding the Anti-Japanese People's Guerrilla Army" Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Swiss Group, said:
					
					It was thanks to the President that the Korean people could achieve the liberation of the country, win in the Fatherland Liberation War against the aggression by the U.S. imperialists and reliably defend socialism while smashing the imperialists' moves against the DPRK.
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il has creditably carried forward the idea and cause of the President.
					
					He always leads Korean-style socialism to victory with his invincible Songun politics.
					
					Eddie Kekana, chairman of the South African Group, said at the seminar on the theme of "President Kim Il Sung, Father of the People":
					
					The President made incessant journey of field guidance by train for the people in the period of peaceful construction.
					
					He even pushed the car mired in a muddy road to continue his journey, saying that he should visit everywhere the people live. Such legendary story has been well known to the world people.
					
					He was such a great person that the Korean people always remember and revere him though many years have passed.
					
					A letter to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the seminar in Switzerland.

articles.title: Radioactive Substance Leaks into Pacific Ocean from Japan
articles.content:
Radioactive Substance Leaks into Pacific Ocean from Japan 
						
 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- Radioactive substance is leaking into the Pacific Ocean from the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant of Japan, raising a more serious problem.
					 On Saturday the Tokyo Electric Power Co. announced that a crack about 20 cm was discovered in the pit that keeps the electric cable of Nuclear Reactor No. 2 of the power plant and the water contained there was confirmed to have flown into the Pacific.
					
					 Radioactive substance was recently detected in the soil of Iidate  Son, Fukushima Prefecture about 40 km away northwest of the power plant while inhabitants had already been asked to evacuate in the areas within the radius of 30 km from the power plant after the occurrence of the quake.
					
					 The Japanese Tokyo Shimbun said this went beyond the evacuation level set by the IAEA.
					
					 It was reported that there rang out voices urging the expansion of the radius of evacuation.
					
					 The director general of the IAEA predicted at a press conference on Friday that the crisis assumed protracted nature, saying that it would take longer than people thought to bring the situation at the power plant under control.
					
					 Nuclear power experts are of the view that it will take more than 20 years to close the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant as it is larger than the Three Mile Nuclear Power Plant of the U.S.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Japan National Police Agency announced that the death toll caused by the quake and the ensuing tsunami increased to 12,087 and the number of those unaccounted for to 15,552 as of 22:00 on Sunday.

articles.title: Nuclear Power Plants in Japan Not in Safety
articles.content:
Nuclear Power Plants in Japan Not in Safety

					
						 
					 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- The nuclear power plants in Japan remain not in safety, said Yomiuri Shimbun of Japan on March 30 quoting a survey data.
					It said that they were not strong enough to stand the tsunami as high as 10 meters caused by the recent megaquake.
					
					If the massive tsunami hits the plants again, there will be such disasters as seen at the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant.

articles.title: Kazakh PM on Troubled Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant
articles.content:
Kazakh PM on Troubled Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant
						

					
						 
					 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- The Kazakh prime minister said that the developments at the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant of Japan should be seen as an important lesson, not a hurdle in atomic energy as a whole. 
					The matters related to this depend mainly on the developments in Japan, he said, adding that his country plans to build a first atomic power plant till 2014.

articles.title: Brazil to Test Radiation Levels in Food from Japan
articles.content:
Brazil to Test Radiation Levels in Food from Japan
						

					
						 
					 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian government decided to test food imported from Japan for contamination by radiation.

					The aim is to prevent the entry of products that may have been exposed to radiation after the leak of radioactive materials from the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant, reported the Brazilian official news agency on March 31.

articles.title: Quake Hits Pakistan, Indonesia
articles.content:
Quake Hits Pakistan, Indonesia
						

					
						 
					 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- An earthquake measuring 5. 2 on the Richter Scale hit Pakistan's northwestern region on April 1.
					The epicenter of the quake was about 185 kilometers from the Mansehra city.
					
					A magnitude-7.1 quake jolted south of Java, Indonesia on Monday.
					
					The epicenter was registered at 10km underwater.
					
					The Indonesian authorities issued a tsunami warning after the earthquake.

articles.title: Medvedev on Establishing University Education System
articles.content:
Medvedev on Establishing University Education System 
						

					
						 
					 Moscow, April 3 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev, addressing a meeting on March 30, expressed his will to set up sound university education system in the country.
					He referred to the fall of the overall standard of educational system including technical education. The government will make strenuous efforts to establish the order in university education, he added.

articles.title: Rehearsals by Arctic Sea Fleet of Russia
articles.content:
Rehearsals by Arctic Sea Fleet of Russia

					
						 
					 Moscow, April 3 (KCNA) -- The Arctic Sea Fleet of Russia staged military exercises in the Barents Sea on Friday.
					Involved there were almost warships and flying corps of the Fleet.
					
					In the exercises the warships removed mines and passed through sea route to destroy submarines of the "enemy" and fired shells to sink two targets on waters.
					
					Pilots of fighters of the flying corps cultivated aeronautics in air battle under the unfavorable weather.
					
					Submariners and naval marines staged a drill for extinguishment and rescue.

articles.title: Liu Yunshan Calls upon Cadres and Party Members to Follow Yang Shanzhou
articles.content:
Liu Yunshan Calls upon Cadres and Party Members to Follow Yang Shanzhou 
						

					
						 
					 Beijing, April 3 (KCNA) -- Liu Yunshan, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China, member of the Central Committee Secretariat and head of the Publicity Department, made a report on the laudable deed of Yang Shanzhou at the  Great Hall of the People on March 29. He called upon cadres and party members to follow him.
					He said that Yang became a model party member as he had the correct ideal and faith. He called upon all the cadres and party members to follow Yang's noble spirit in order to make steady efforts to build socialism with Chinese characteristics.
					
					He underscored the need to self-cultivate themselves as befitting a party member as Yang did and remain loyal to the cause of the party and serve the people.

articles.title: Jia Qinglin Urges Efforts to Boost Development of Machinery Industry
articles.content:
Jia Qinglin Urges Efforts to Boost Development of Machinery Industry
						

					
						 
					 Beijing, April 3 (KCNA) -- China's top political advisor Jia Qinglin on Tuesday called for more efforts to push forward the development of machinery industry. 
					Jia, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and chairman of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference, made the remarks during a meeting with members of the China Machinery Industry Federation.
					
					He said that the federation would creditably perform its role, bring about innovation in its work system, accelerate mergers and acquisitions to forge conglomerates, and make a new and greater contribution to developing China into a machinery industry power.

articles.title: Venezuelan President Stresses Importance of Unity
articles.content:
Venezuelan President Stresses Importance of Unity
						

					
						 
					 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- Hugo Chavez Frias, president of Venezuela, stressed the importance of unity in a speech made during his recent visit to Uruguay.
					Regional unity among like-minded countries is a guarantee for protection against imperialist machinations, he said
					
					"We must unite, that's our only salvation," he said, calling for Latin American unity in which brotherly countries could be brought together under one flag.

articles.title: Ecuadorian FM on Cuban Aid
articles.content:
Ecuadorian FM on Cuban Aid
 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- Ecuadorian Foreign Minister Ricardo Patino, speaking on behalf of his people and government on March 30, expressed immense gratitude to the Cuban people for its solidarity in training physicians, despite the criminal U.S.-imposed blockade over 50 years ago.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias al presidente namibio
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias al presidente namibio  
						

					
						 
					Pyongyang, 5 de abril (ATCC) -- En relacion con que la region septentrional de Namibia sufrio hace poco las inundaciones, el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio la vispera un mensaje de condolencias al presidente de ese pais africano, Hifikepunye Pohamba.
						
					
					En la misiva, el remitente expreso profunda compasion y condolencias a los habitantes de la zona damnificada y manifesto su conviccion de que bajo la correcta guia del destinatario, el gobierno y el pueblo namibios eliminaran cuanto antes las secuelas del siniestro natural.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim averigua la situacion de empresas en la zona septentrionalS
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim averigua la situacion de empresas en la zona septentrional

					
						 
					Pyongyang, 5 de abril (ATCC) -- El primer ministro Choe Yong Rim visito desde el 30 de marzo hasta el primero de abril el Complejo Minero de Musan, la Mina Carbonifera de Soksong del Complejo Carbonifero de la Zona de Myongchon y la Granja Fruticola de Ryongjon, situados en la region norte del pais. 
					
					En el Complejo Minero de Musan, renombrada base de produccion de minerales concentrados, el tomo medidas para acelerar el engrandecimiento y la modernizacion de los equipos de extraccion y transporte e incrementar en un corto plazo la produccion mediante el desprendimiento y la evacuacion de minerales en grandes cantidades.
					
					Ademas, discutio el problema de impulsar la construccion de muchas galerias de explotacion de carbon en la Mina Carbonifera de Soksong, de acuerdo con la marcha en etapa final de la obra de gasificacion de Hungnam.
					
					En su recorrido por la Granja Fruticola de Ryongjon, modernizada con motivo del 50o aniversario de la reunion ampliada de Pukchong, organizo los trabajos para la cientifizacion, la intensificacion y la modernizacion de la produccion de frutas y aumentar considerablemente la dimension de huertas.

articles.title: Sur de Corea es culpable de la ruptura de relaciones intercoreanas
articles.content:
Sur de Corea es culpable de la ruptura de relaciones intercoreanas 
						

					
						 
					Pyongyang, 5 de abril (ATCC) -- Debido a las fuerzas gobernantes surcoreanas que tratan de imputar a toda costa a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea la responsabilidad de hundimiento de la corbeta "Cheonan", se ha desvanecido el dificilmente creado ambiente de la mejora de relaciones entre ambas parte coreanas y la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana vuelve a la grave fase de confrontacion. 
					
					Senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual difundido en su edicion de este martes y prosigue:
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas son culpables de la agravacion de tensiones en la Peninsula Coreana y de la ruptura de relaciones Norte-Sur.
					
					La situacion catastrofica de las actuales relaciones intercoreanas no se debe al caso del "Cheonan", sino es resultado inevitable y continuacion de la politica conflictiva anti-RPDC de las fuerzas gobernantes surcoreanas.
					
					Ellas rehusan obstinadamente cambiar su conflictiva "politica sobre el Norte" cuyo fracaso se ha comprobado evidentemente en los ultimos 3 anos. En particular, hasta ahora a un ano desde el hundimiento de "Cheonan", presentan como premisa de la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas las "medidas responsables" de la RPDC por el respecto y justifican el enfrentamiento y la campana belicista contra ella.
					
					Si las autoridades surcoreanas tienen la mas minima voluntad de mejorar las relaciones intercoreanas, deben dejar de vincular malintencionadamente el caso del "Cheonan" con la RPDC. En el caso contrario, todos veran la siniestra intencion de ellas de llevar a la ruptura total las relaciones Norte-Sur tildando a la connacional RPDC de "provocadora" e imponer los desastres de guerra nuclear a los compatriotas.
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas deben proceder cuanto antes a la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas viendo bien la corriente de la epoca y la aspiracion de toda la nacion a la estabilidad, la reunificacion pacifica de la Peninsula Coreana y la coprosperidad nacional.
					
					El mejoramiento de relaciones intercoreanas y la preservacion de la paz en la Peninsula Coreana dependen totalmente de la actitud de ellas.

articles.title: Minju Joson denuncia maniobras agresivas de EE.UU. contra la RPDC
articles.content:
Minju Joson denuncia maniobras agresivas de EE.UU. contra la RPDC 
						

					
						 
					Pyongyang, 5 de abril (ATCC) -- El periodico Minju Joson inserto en su edicion de este martes un comentario individual denunciando a EE.UU. y los titeres surcoreanos por agravar la confrontacion militar y la tension recrudeciendo la campana belicista contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. 
					
					El 23 de marzo pasado, ellos desarrollaron un ejercicio de apoyo militar maritimo de gran envergadura como parte del simulacro conjunto "Foal Eagle" mostrando su caracter agresivo y aventurero.
					
					La meta principal de "Foal Eagle" es desarmar y aplastar a la RPDC al asestar el golpe preventivo y tridimensional sobre la retaguardia estrategica y los puntos importantes de ella movilizando todos los medios, incluso armas nucleares.
					
					Lo mas grave del caso es que EE.UU. esta trazando otro plan de ataque muy aventurero pretextando la "amenaza" de alguien.
					
					El pasado 28 de marzo, los belicistas estadounidenses sostuvieron con los titeres surcoreanos la llamada reunion de la comision de la politica de no proliferacion.
					
					Esa reunion, que coincide con "Foal Eagle", es una conspiracion para consolidar el sistema de cooperacion entre EE.UU. y el Sur de Corea en la agresion a la RPDC aprovechando el empeoramiento de la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana y desatar a cualquier precio la guerra nuclear en el territorio coreano.
					
					Para ese fin, se movilizan en "Foal Eagle" enormes fuerzas armadas y ultramodernos equipos de guerra y se desarrollan los ejercicios militares de toda indole para hacer frente a cualquier contingencia de guerra.
					
					Debido a tales maniobras de los imperialistas norteamericanos, se cierne el nubarron de guerra nuclear en la Peninsula Coreana y se ve amenazada gravemente la paz de la Peninsula Coreana y el resto del Nordeste Asiatico, lo cual influye negativamente en la preservacion de paz mundial.
					
					Si los imperialistas norteamericanos se atreven a provocar una nueva guerra contra la RPDC, el ejercito y pueblo de ella castigaran despiadadamente a los invasores movilizando todos los medios militares.
